title: Epic 1: Styling Architecture Migration
description: Migrate from monolithic 6,686-line CSS file to a scalable styling solution (Tailwind CSS or CSS Modules). This blocks all future UI work and affects developer productivity.

title: 1.1: Evaluate CSS approaches (Tailwind vs CSS Modules)
description: Research and decide between Tailwind CSS, CSS Modules, or other approaches. Document pros/cons, migration effort, and team preference. Create ADR (Architecture Decision Record).

title: Epic 2: Component Refactoring
description: Break down monster components (Part.tsx 1,974 lines, Workspace.tsx 1,621 lines, CutListModal.tsx 1,126 lines) into smaller, maintainable components. Critical for code maintainability.

title: 2.1: Reorganize component directory structure
description: Organize components by feature/domain instead of flat structure. Move components into: common/, layout/, workspace/, project/, stock/, assembly/, template/, settings/, licensing/, tutorial/, parts-list/. Low risk, high value quick win.

title: 2.2: Break down Part.tsx (1,974 lines)
description: Split Part.tsx into: Part (main), PartGeometry, PartInteraction, PartLabel, PartGrain, PartEdges, ReferenceLines, usePartInteraction hook. See review-notes/07-desktop-ui-components.md for details.

title: 2.3: Break down Workspace.tsx (1,621 lines)
description: Split Workspace.tsx into: Workspace (orchestrator), WorkspaceCanvas, WorkspaceCamera, WorkspaceControls, WorkspaceGrid, WorkspaceLighting, WorkspaceScene, WorkspaceHelpers, PartRenderer, and custom hooks.

title: Epic 3: State Management Split
description: Split the 2,663-line god object store (projectStore.ts) into 7-8 focused stores (UI, camera, selection, snap, etc.). Improves performance and maintainability.

title: 3.1: Design store split architecture
description: Design how to split projectStore into: projectStore (domain data), uiStore (modals/toast), cameraStore (viewport), selectionStore (selected items), snapStore (snap system), assemblyEditingStore (edit mode), licenseStore (feature limits). Document data flow and inter-store communication.

title: Epic 4: Performance Optimization
description: Profile and optimize Three.js rendering, component re-renders, and bundle size. Improve overall application performance.

title: 4.1: Profile Three.js rendering performance
description: Use Chrome DevTools and React Profiler to identify rendering bottlenecks. Measure FPS, identify unnecessary re-renders, check memory usage. Document findings in review-notes/02-desktop-3d-workspace.md.

title: Epic 5: Testing Improvements
description: Review and improve test coverage (currently 85%), add integration tests for critical paths, and improve test performance.

title: Epic 6: Website Polish
description: Split 2,314-line DocsPage, add screenshots (blocked on logo), improve SEO, and enhance mobile experience.
